

# RNAseq data analysis

## data Exploratory

> Raw count

```{r raw data rnaseq}
#data <- paste0("RNAseq.",data)

assay(FlomicsMultiAssay[[data]])[1:5,1:5]

```


> Library size & count distribution

```{r libSize , fig.show = "hold", out.width = "50%"}
knitr::include_graphics(c(file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images","LibSize.png"), 
                          file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images","CountDist.png")))
```

> Principal component analysis

>> Design 

```{r pca raw design 1 , fig.show = "hold", out.width = "50%"}
knitr::include_graphics(list.files (path = file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images"), 
                                    pattern = "PCAdesign_RNAseq_", 
                                    full.names = TRUE))
```

```{r pca raw design 2 , fig.show = "hold"}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images","PCAdesignCoordRaw.png"))
```

>> metadata

```{r pca raw meta , fig.show = "hold"}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images","PCAmetaCorrRaw.png"))
```

## Filtering and Normalisation

> Normalisation method : `r FlomicsMultiAssay[["RNAseq.filtred"]]@metadata$Normalization$methode`

```{r boxplot , fig.show = "hold"}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images","norm.boxplot.png"))
```


```{r pca norm design , fig.show = "hold", out.width = "50%"}
knitr::include_graphics(list.files (path = file.path(tmpDir, "RNAseq","images"), 
                                    pattern = "PCAdesign_RNAseq.filtred_", 
                                    full.names = TRUE))
```
